body:
Hi Greg,


Thanks for your quick response. Yes, in my conversion to OSX I'd 
forgotten that I was now working with bash and hence had a space in the 
path statement where it should not have been.  Back to basics 101.  
Thanks again.


Best regards,
Chris






Hi Chris,


This sounds like a RAYPATH issue.  What do you get when you type "echo 
$RAYPATH"?  I'm guessing you don't have '.' in the path for some 
reason.  Either that, or the directory you're in doesn't have the right 
permissions.  (Though I would expect an earlier error in that case.)  
What do you get when you type "ls -l illum12.dat"?


-Greg
